alert.note: Alert for Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands; Bent County Including Las Animas; Crowley County Including Ordway; Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon; Kiowa County Including Eads; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Prowers County Including Lamar (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 12 at 6:35AM MDT until April 13 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning now in effect until 8 PM today for very strong winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 222, and 226 through 230, which includes El Paso, Pueblo, Fremont, Huerfano, and western Las Animas Counties... ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM today for very strong winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 224, 225, and 231 through 237, which includes portions of the southeast plains, Teller County, the southeast mountains, and the San Luis Valley... ...Fire Weather Watch remains in effect for Wednesday afternoon and evening for strong winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 227, 228, and 230 through 237 which includes most of the plains in southeast Colorado. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 231...232...233...234...235...236 AND 237... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 231...232...233... 234...235...236 AND 237... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 231...232...233...234... 235...236 and 237. * Winds...Northwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
